{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"modern CT scanners", "p":"uses", "o":"1,000 projections", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In modern CT scanners, such as those from GE or Siemens, a typical rotation collects about 1,000 projections"},
    {"s":"detector array", "p":"captures", "o":"thousands of data points", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"At each projection, the detector array works like a comb beam or multi-row detector, capturing thousands of data points along each ray path"},
    {"s":"image quality", "p":"depends_on", "o":"angular sampling intervals", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Angular sampling is also critical. If you have nearly 1,000 views around the object, image quality is good. Using fewer views leads to aliasing artifacts and lower image quality"},
    {"s":"image quality", "p":"depends_on", "o":"detector element sizes", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"To resolve fine details,

evidence: Angular sampling is also critical. If you have nearly 1,000 views around the object, image quality is good. Using fewer views leads to aliasing artifacts and lower image quality
